From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To list the open sessions, use the **where** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following is sample output from the where command:
Conn Host Address Byte Idle Conn Name
The asterisk (*) indicates the current terminal session.
[ Table 173 ] (#wp1011728) describes the fields shown in the display.
| Conn | Name or address of the remote host to which the connection is made. |
| Host | Remote host to which the router is connected through a Telnet session. |
| Address | IP address of the remote host. |
| Byte | Number of unread bytes for the user to see on the connection. |
| Idle | Interval (in minutes) since data was last sent on the line. |
| Conn Name | Assigned name of the connection. |
ExtraInfo: The **where** command displays all open sessions associated with the current terminal line.The break (Ctrl-Shift-6, x), **where**, and **resume** commands are available with all supported connection protocols.

RelatedCmds.description: Displays information about all lines on the system or the specified line.
Displays information about open LAT, Telnet, or rlogin connections.
